Figure 2:Heatmap of averageactivatedrouter logits across BigBench tasks (rows) and experts (columns) in DeepSeek-R1. Red indicates high positive logits, blue negative ones. The sparse patterns of red highlights task-specific expert specialization.
Figure 3:Example of Reasoning generation of DeepSeek-R1 with different pruning ratios.

The top example uses our default collection strategy (query + reasoning output), while the bottom example derives patterns only from the input query, leading to repetitive output for DeepSeek-R1 (8/32).
Figure A.2:Example 2 of Reasoning generation of DeepSeek-R1 with different pruning ratios (8/256, 8/128, 8/32) using PreMoe.
